title: Facial Anatomy and Cosmetic Procedure Skills Education Based on the ADDAPT Model

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Biology and General Understanding of Human Anatomy
context.additional_context: Corporate training for beauty treatment professionals, featuring hands-on learning environments utilizing digital devices (tablets, 3D anatomical simulation software)

learning_goals: Using the 6-stage ADDAPT model (Assess/Recognize, Demonstrate, Interpret, Execute/Achieve, Perform, Teach/Verify), learners can explain more than 15 facial muscle structures and functions.
Applying contextual learning strategies, learners can apply anatomical knowledge and safety protocols required for actual aesthetic treatment scenarios (fillers, Botox) with 90% accuracy.
Through team-based practical assessments, learners can demonstrate facial symmetry analysis and treatment planning skills with peer evaluation scores of over 85%.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
